content:
• Wednesday, February 7, 2018

  • Futures modestly lower in volatile evening session

    • Stock index futures at one point tonight had been down nearly 1% across the board, but they've bounced off of those lows.
    • S&P 500 and DJIA futures are currently off 0.25%, and Nasdaq 100 down 0.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 PM | 10 Comments
  • BLKB

    Blackbaud issues $2,000 stock awards in response to tax reform

    • Blackbaud (NASDAQ:BLKB) is reacting to changes in federal tax law with a one-time stock award of $2,000 for eligible employees.
    • Based on tax reform and some sunny performance and outlook, the company says employees who don't already receive equity as part of its annual stock award program will receive the payout.
    • Awards will be issued Feb. 28 and vest one year later.
    • The company has about 3,200 total employees globally.
    • Shares rose 8.3% today after beating expectations with earnings yesterday.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • NTES

    E-commerce makes up for gaming decline at NetEase; shares -5%

    • NetEase (NASDAQ:NTES) is 5.1% lower in postmarket trading after a mixed quarter where a boost in e-commerce more than made up for declines in its online gaming.
    • The company changed segment disclosure to report out e-commerce separately due to its significant revenue contribution; it mainly reflects the results of two platforms, Kaola.com and Yanxuan.
    • Gross profit dipped to 5.74B yuan (about $883M) from a prior-year 6.46B yuan; profits fell in online games and e-mail and others, but grew in e-commerce as well as ad services (from enhanced monetization and better economies of scale).
    • Net income on a non-GAAP basis fell to 1.9B yuan ($288.8M) from 4B yuan in the prior-year Q4.
    • Revenue by segment: Online game services, 8B yuan (about $1.23B, down 10.7% in yuan terms); E-commerce, 4.65B yuan (about $715.3M, up 175%); Advertising services, 736.6M yuan (about $113.2M, up 10.8%); E-mail and others, 1.21B yuan (about $186.4M, up 54.8%).
    • Conference call to come at 8 p.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 6:47 PM | 8 Comments
  • TSLA

    Highlights from Tesla's conference call

    • Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) CEO Elon Musk runs over the company's 2017 highlights, while also acknowledging the "problems" with Model 3 production.
    • On a lighter note, Musk says if a Roadster is heading to the Asteroid Belt after a boost from a SpaceX rocket, Model 3 production headaches should be solved.
    • There's some drilling down by Musk on the progress of the production lines and manual vs. automation on certain modules, but the major point is that the ramp is accelerating.
    • When asked about the current run rate, Tesla execs skirt pinpointing a number to note that certain constraints will be cleared shortly.
    • When asked about the succession plan at Tesla, Musk says no changes are anticipated and no successor has been picked.
    • Tesla plans to make some capital investments at the end of the year on the Model Y. The 1M production target on the Model Y is still in play, says Musk.
    • Confidence is expressed that Tesla will meet the planned specs on the Semi model.
    • A question on Tesla's non-inclusion of LIDAR with its autonomous plans is batted away. Musk says the company is taking the "hard path" to achieve the maximum goal of autonomy, instead of the limited LIDAR solution.
    • Gross margin rates on the Model S and Model X are expected to recover later this year as the selling mix improves.
    • Previously: Tesla beats by $0.08, beats on revenue (Feb. 7)
    • Previously: Tesla sticks with Model 3 production targets (Feb. 7)
    • Shares of Tesla are still in positive territory in AH trading, up 1.27% to $349.44.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:59 PM | 304 Comments
  • CDE

    Coeur Mining +3% as silver equivalent output hits record

    • Coeur Mining (NYSE:CDE) +3.1% after-hours despite missing Q4 earnings expectations, as it also reports a 54% Y/Y rise in revenues and record silver equiv. production.
    • CDE says results were driven by record silver equiv. production in both Q4 and FY 2017 of 10.8 million ounces (11.7M oz. including discontinued operations) and 35.1M oz. (39.4M oz. including discontinued operations), respectively, as well as lower costs from continuing operations and decreases in working capital.
    • CDE says Q4 cash flow from operating activities more than doubled Q/Q to $91.8M, and adjusted EBITDA and free cash flow of $77M and $44.8M, respectively, increased ~5X from the prior quarter.
    • For 2018, CDE forecasts total silver equiv. production of 36K-39.3K oz.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:58 PM | 4 Comments

  • ORLY

    O’Reilly Automotive peels off 2% after earnings

    • O’Reilly Automotive (NASDAQ:ORLY) reports comparable store sales increased 1.3% in Q4.
    • Gross margin came in at 52.9% of sales.
    • The company says it increased its buyback authorization by an additional $1.0B billion to bring its buyback firepower to a total of $10.75B.
    • Looking ahead, O'Reilly expects full-year comparable sales growth of 2% to 4% and revenue of $9.4B to $9.6B vs. $9.46B. Full-year EPS of $15.10 to $15.20 is anticipated.
    • ORLY -2.41% after hours to $246.00.
    • Source: Press Release
    • Previously: O'Reilly Automotive misses by $0.02, revenue in-line (Feb. 7)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:29 PM

  • CSRA

    CSRA +2.9% on Q3 beats, upside guidance

    • CSRA (NYSE:CSRA) shares are up 2.9% aftermarket following Q3 results that beat revenue and EPS estimates.
    • Upside FY18 guidance: Revenue, $5.15B to $5.2B (consensus: $5B); EPS, $2 to $2.05 (consensus: $1.88); adjusted EBITDA, $805M to $825M; FCF, $330M to $380M. 
    • Key metrics: Bookings, $1.6B; backlog of signed business orders, $18.2B ($2.6B of it funded); operating cash flow, $157M; FCF, $133M; adjusted EBITDA, $201M; cash and equivalents, $80M; debt, $2.7B.
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 5 PM Eastern with a webcast available here. 
    • Press release     
    • Previously: CSRA beats by $0.09, beats on revenue (Feb. 7)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM
  • TTWO

    Take-Two revenues miss; company boosts full-year guidance

    • Take-Two Interactive Software (NASDAQ:TTWO) has dipped 2.7% in postmarket trading despite Q3 profits that beat on an adjusted basis and lifted guidance for the coming year, but alongside revenues that fell short of consensus.
    • Total revenues fell 12%; on an as-reported basis, it was $480.8M along with a change in deferred net revenue of $173.1M. Recurrent consumer spending was up 64% Y/Y and made up 32% of the total.
    • Digitally delivered net revenue was up 8% to $258.4M and made up 54% of the total; largest contributors were Grand Theft Auto Online and GTA V, along with NBA 2K18, WWE 2K18 and WWE SuperCard, and Sid Meier's Civilization VI.
    • Net cash from operations was $203M; cash and short-term investments came to $1.322B as of Dec. 31.
    • For Q4, it's guiding to GAAP net revenue of $460M-$510M and net bookings of $410M-$460M (vs. consensus for $451.1M); GAAP EPS is seen at $0.73-$0.83.
    • For the full year, it's boosting adjusted EPS expectations to $3.19-$3.26 from $2.81-$3.00, and raised its guidance on adjusted revenues to $1.99B-$2.04B from $1.93B-$2.03B.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM | 47 Comments
  • CNX

    CNX to sell West Virginia gas gathering system to CNX Midstream for $265M

    • CNX Resources (NYSE:CNX) +2.8% after-hours as it agrees to sell its 95% interest in the Shirley-Pennsboro gathering system in West Virginia to CNX Midstream Partners (NYSE:CNXM) for $265M.
    • Shirley-Pennsboro gathers and transports gas in the core wet gas region of the Marcellus Shale in West Virginia and currently has 180M cfe/day of flowing production.
    • The deal is expected to add $22M-$24M of 2018 EBITDA for CNXM on a full year pro forma basis, with substantial EBITDA growth expected beyond 2018; CNX expects a negligible impact to 2018 EBITDA guidance since a transaction was contemplated in its prior guidance numbers.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM | 11 Comments
  • YUMC

    KFC strength lifts Yum China

    • Yum China (NYSE:YUMC) slips past Q4 estimates on a 5% increase in same-store sales.
    • Same-store sales were up 7% for the KFC business and 1% for Pizza Hut.
    • Restaurant margin improved 30 bps to 11.3%.
    • Operating profit rose 23% during the quarter.
    • The company ended the quarter with 7,983 units, up 6% Y/Y.
    • Previously: Yum China beats by $0.01, beats on revenue (Feb. 7)
    • YUMC +1.58% AH to $45.00.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:47 PM | 12 Comments
  • LCI

    Lannett FQ2 top line up 8%; non-GAAP earnings up 18%; sales guidance lowered; shares down 12% after hours

    • Lannett Company (NYSEMKT:LCI) fiscal Q2 results ($M): Net sales: 184.3 (+7.8%).
    • Net Income: 14.0 (+70.7%); non-GAAP net income: 40.6 (+17.7%); EPS: 0.37 (+68.2%); non-GAAP EPS: 1.06 (+15.2%).
    • 2018 guidance: Net sales: $680M - 700M from $710M - 720M.
    • Shares are down 12% after hours on average volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:47 PM
  • SYNA

    Synaptics +6.8% after Q2 rev. beat, in-line guidance

    • Synaptics (NASDAQ:SYNA) shares are up 6.8% aftermarket following Q2 results that beat EPS estimates but met on revenue.
    • In-line Q3 guidance puts revenue from $380M to $420M (consensus: $414.39M) and expects revenue mix as follows: 61% mobile, 23% consumer IoT, and 16% PC. 
    • Revenue breakdown: Mobile products, $261.8M (-30% Y/Y, 61% of revenue); Consumer IoT, $106.9M (25% of revenue); PC products, $61.7M (-3% Y/Y, 14% of revenue). 
    • Note: Approximately $20.9M of mobile product revenue for Q2 was reclassified as IoT. 
    • Key metrics: Cash and equivalents, $252M; cash flow from operations, $63M; operating expenses, $139.2M.
    • Earnings call scheduled for 5 PM Eastern with a webcast available here.  
    • Press release      
    • Previously: Synaptics enters mass production for in-display fingerprint sensor (Dec. 12, 2017)
    • Previously: Forbes reveals OEM using Synaptics' in-display sensor (Dec. 15, 2017)

  • CRC

    California Resources announces new midstream JV, equity investment

    • California Resources Corp. (NYSEMKT:CRC) +3.6% after-hours after announcing a midstream joint venture with a portfolio company of the Private Equity Group of Ares Management.
    • CRC says the Ares company will invest $750M in the venture and has purchased ~2.34M CRC common shares in a private placement for $21.33/share based on a recent volume-weighted average price.
    • CRC will purchase power and gas processing from the JV, which owns the Elk Hills gas-fired power plant and a 200M cf/day cryogenic gas processing plant located near Bakersfield, Calif.

  • YELP

    Yelp slides amid light guidance on underlying profit

    • Yelp (NYSE:YELP) has slipped 5.5% after hours following a Q4 report where its revenues topped the highest estimates, but profits looked to have fallen short after accounting for the Eat24 sale, and EBITDA guidance came up light.
    • GAAP net income was $142.1M vs. a year-ago $8.3M; results included a $164.8M pretax gain on selling Eat24.
    • EBITDA of $41.6M was down from a year-ago $45.3M and was in line with consensus.
    • Ad revenue grew 18% to $208.4M; transactions revenue fell to $5.2M from $16.6M (affected by the Eat24 sale). Other services revenue was $4.6M vs. a year-ago $1.7M.
    • For Q1, it's guiding to revenues of $218M-$221M (vs. consensus for $219.4M) and EBITDA of $29M-$32M (light of expected $38M); for the full year, it sees net revenues at $935M-$965M (vs. $951.4M consensus) and EBITDA of $175M-$187M (light of consensus for $196.4M).
    • Conference call to come at 4:30 p.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM

  • U.S. crude oil slides to lowest settlement in a month

    • U.S. crude oil futures tumbled to a one-month low $61.79/bbl, -2.5%, following a second straight weekly rise in U.S. crude stockpiles and record domestic production.
    • Brent crude losses were slightly lighter, -2% at $65.51, after the Forties pipeline in the North Sea was shut due to the closure of a feed control valve; operator Ineos says it hopes to resolve the issue by tonight.
    • The EIA reported a 1.9M-barrel increase in weekly domestic crude supplies as well as a jump in U.S. production of 332K barrels to total 10.25M bbl/day, a weekly record based on EIA data going back to 1983 - results sure to “bring the remaining bears out of hibernation," says James Williams, energy economist at WTRG Economics.
    • ETFs: USO, XLE, OIL, UWT, UCO, VDE, XOP, DWT, ERX, OIH, SCO, BNO, DBO, XES, ERY, DIG, BGR, GUSH, DTO, FENY, USL, IYE, DUG, DRIP, IEO, FIF, IEZ, DNO, NDP, PXE, OLO, RYE, PXJ, SZO, CRAK, FXN, OLEM, WTIU, DDG, OILK, NANR, OILX, WTID, USOI, USOU, USOD, FTXN, JHME, UBRT, ERYY, DBRT, ERGF, USAI
     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM | 15 Comments
  • XL

    M&A animal spirits stokes reinsurers

    • According to Bloomberg, XL Group (XL +8.2%) is drawing buyout interest from a number of players, including Allianz (OTCPK:AZSEY -0.4%).
    • The news has put a charge into other possible consolidation targets as well: Axis Capital (AXS +3.8%), Everest Re (RE +2.4%), Reinsurance Group (RGA +1.3%), RenaissanceRe (RNR +2.7%), Arch Capital (ACGL +1.6%), Aspen Insurance (AHL +1.2%).
    • Previously: WSJ: SoftBank in talks to buy up to a third of Swiss Re (Feb. 7)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM | 1 Comment
  • PXD

    Pioneer Natural pops 2% as Q4 reaffirms potential as Permian's best performer

    • Pioneer Natural Resources (PXD +2.4%) maintains solid gains as investors reward the company for focusing more on returns than growth - as shown by a sharp dividend increase and stock buyback - and its plan to sell off its assets outside of the Permian basin.
    • Bloomberg's Liam Denning says the outsize cash margins in PXD's Permian fracking business make it a no-brainer to focus its attention there, and notes the stock now will offer a pure play on the hottest U.S. shale property "and, it has to be said, a cleaner potential acquisition target at a time when domestic oil majors are re-discovering their love of home."
    • B. Riley FBR reiterates its Buy rating and $305 price target, believing the technology- and process-driven productivity gains expected over the next 6-12 months combined with the expected recognition of material resource expansion potential,should help PXD reclaim its position as a leader in U.S. oil shale growth.
    • Stifel analysts also keep their Buy rating, as the results reaffirm its position that PXD has the potential to be the best performing Permian large cap in 2018.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM | 2 Comments

    Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2.55 pm (2/7/18)

  • CHK

    Chesapeake Energy plunges to two-year low after flat production outlook

    • Chesapeake Energy (CHK -7.5%) sinks to its lowest in two years after its Q4 production update disappoints investors.
    • CHK says Q4 production reached 593M boe vs. consensus of 565M boe, but expects 2018 volumes to come in roughly flat vs. last year’s ~525M boe pro-forma base, below the comparable consensus of 541M boe after adjusting for 23M boe from assets that have been divested.
    • The update prompts Credit Suisse analyst William Featherston to cut his forecasts for CHK's production for 2018 and 2019 to a respective 533M boe and 547M boe; the firm maintains its Underperform rating and $3 price target in the stock.
    • CHK also announced three separate sales of Oklahoma wells and leases for ~$500M, at a price Featherston thinks a fair 7x cash flow, plus ~4.3M shares of fracking services provider FTS International (FTSI -4.5%) for $78M; CHK still holds ~22M shares in the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM | 163 Comments
  • WD

    Walker & Dunlop up nearly 5% after big quarter

    • Q4 net income (after backing out gain from tax bill) of $40.7M or $1.26 per share, up 11% Y/Y. Adjusted EBTIDA of $54.7M up 58%. Full-year net income (ex. tax bill) of $4.76 per share up 34%.
    • Total transaction volume up 33% Y/Y to $8.3B. Loan origination volume up 30% to 6.86B, investment sales volume up 45% to $1.46B.
    • Servicing portfolio up 18% to $74.5B. Weighted-average servicing fee of 25.7 basis points vs. 26.1 bps a y ear ago.
    • Previously: Walker & Dunlop beats by $0.24, beats on revenue (Feb. 7)

  • CLF

    Cleveland-Cliffs gets two-notch upgrade from Credit Suisse

    • Cleveland-Cliffs (CLF +2.5%) is higher after Credit Suisse issues a double upgrade to Outperform from Underperform with a $9 price target, up from $5, expecting hot-rolled coil steel prices to remain strong in 2018.
    • The firm views sees strong accretion from the HBI project with the move away from less profitable pellet contracts towards high margin DR pellet based HBI.
    • On CLF's Q4 earnings conference call, CEO Lourenco Goncalves noted the positive prospects of HBI, saying "The ability for Cliffs to produce DR-grade pellets is what makes our venture in HBI so value-accretive."

  • GILD

    FDA OKs Gilead's BIC/FTC/TAF for HIV-1 infection

    • The FDA approves Gilead Sciences' (GILD +3.3%) triple combo pill BIC/FTC/TAF, branded as BIKTARVY, for the treatment of adults with chronic HIV-1 infection. The agency's action date was February 12.
    • Previously: FDA grants accelerated review of Gilead's NDA for HIV med BIC/FTC/TAF, action date February 12 (Aug. 10, 2017)

  • SFTBY

    WSJ: SoftBank in talks to buy up to a third of Swiss Re

    • SoftBank (OTCPK:SFTBY +4.9%) is in "advanced" talks to buy a stake in insurance giant Swiss Re (OTCPK:SSREY) that could amount to a third of the company, The Wall Street Journal reports.
    • That could be worth $10B or more, just the latest in a string of eye-opening investments from the conglomerate that's expanding rapidly beyond telecom.
    • Swiss Re is worth about 31.7B Swiss francs (about $33B). SoftBank would be paying a premium for the shares, the WSJ says.
    • Sources told the paper that the reinsurer's top management traveled to Tokyo in recent weeks to meet with SoftBank execs including CEO Masayoshi Son.
    • Updated 2:15 p.m.: OTCPK:SSREY is up more than 8% as a result of the report.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM | 10 Comments

    General Cannabis registers $50M mixed shelf offering; shares down 4%

    • Legal weed consultant General Cannabis (OTCQX:CANN -4.1%) files a prospectus for a $50M mixed shelf offering, including 150K shares by existing investors. Net proceeds will be use for general (no pun intended) corporate purposes.

  • VIA

    Viacom closes AR/VR studio in cost-cutting moves

    • Viacom (VIA -1.9%, VIAB -1.7%) is shuttering its virtual reality/augmented reality studio, Viacom Next.
    • The company has laid off 100 employees across multiple divisions as part of cost cuts, and Viacom Next is a casualty. Some staffers will get offers from other parts of the company, Viacom says.
    • The work done at the studio will be absorbed into Viacom's Global Emerging Opportunities Group, the company says.
    • It had launched the effort in 2016, and Viacom Next started working with the NYC Media Lab last year on the intersection of VR and music.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:52 PM
  • BMRN

    BioMarin slips 2% on underwhelming data on Sanfilippo B candidate BMN 250

    • BioMarin Pharmaceutical (BMRN -1.7%) slips on below-average volume on the heels of its announcement of preliminary results from a Phase 1/2 clinical trial evaluating enzyme replacement therapy BMN 250 in patients with mucopolysaccharidosis IIIB (MPS IIIB), also known as Sanfilippo B syndrome. The data were presented at WORLDSymposium in San Diego, CA.
    • The first part of the trial is a dose-escalation study (30 mg, 100 mg, 300 mg). The second part is observational with all participants receiving the 300 mg dose after "rolling over" into the second stage from the first stage.
    • Interim results were based on three subjects from Part 1 and three from Part 2 (Study 250-901). All three Part 1 patients experienced decreases in liver size into the normal range for their age. Data on the first three rollover patients is pending. Also, the data suggests stabilization of cognitive decline, but additional data are needed for confirmation.
    • Elevated baseline levels of heparan sulfate, the specific large sugar molecule that MPS IIIB sufferers cannot break down, in cerebrospinal fluid dropped to normal ranges in all six patients after treatment. The specific relational reductions are not provided, however.
    • The company says BMN 250 was "well-tolerated" but treatment-related adverse events (AEs) were numerous due to the nature of enzyme replacement therapy and the intracerebroventricular (ICV) infusion method of administration, required to bypass the blood brain barrier. The most common AE was ICV infection prior to infusion. Other AEs included skin reddening at the injection site, increased white blood cell count in cerebrospinal fluid (CSF), blood clotting in CSF, high fever, vomiting and headache.
    • Although very early in the development process, Abeona's gene therapy ABO-101 appears more efficacious with less side effects and a much more patient-friendly route of administration. Investors apparently agree, ABEO is up 13%.
    • Previously: Abeona's gene therapy candidate for Sanfilippo B shows encouraging effect in first patient; shares up 12% (Feb. 7)

    Match earnings call: Plans for 2H deceleration, mentions tech patent

    • Match Group’s (NASDAQ:MTCH) earnings call provides more color on the quarter and mention of a patent that could influence the rumored acquisition of Bumble.
    • Match says 90% of revenue comes from subscriptions. Tinder doubled subscriptions for the second year in a row and represented 30% of total revenue in 2017.
    • Tinder subscription growth will slow from 2H levels in Q1 and will then return to the net adds of 220K to 225K (or the pre-Gold average).

    • Interesting quote from Match Group CEO Mindy Ginsberg: “On the product front, Tinder has been on the cutting edge of innovation since its inception in 2012, inventing the swipe gesture, which has since become this cultural phenomenon of 'swipe right' and 'swipe left' and that is often imitated on mobile products. Tinder also invented the 'double blind opt-in' whereby two users need to 'like' each other before they can message. In fact, these features are so innovative that Tinder was granted a patent in the dating category by the US Patent & Trademark office which we think is valuable."
    • Axios tracked down the patent from 2013, which was before Whitney Wolfe Herd left Tinder to found Bumble, but neither Herd nor former Tinder boss Justin Mateen is listed on the patent.
    • Ginsberg doesn’t say anything about Match plans to enforce the patent but its existence could provide some leverage in any potential M&A talks.
    • Bumble notably features a female-first experience where women initiate conversations. Match outlined plans for a similar focus for Tinder in the earnings report.
    • Match Group shares are up 10.6%.

  • ABEO

    Abeona's gene therapy candidate for Sanfilippo B shows encouraging effect in first patient; shares up 12%

    • Abeona Therapeutics (ABEO +11.6%) is up on modestly higher volume in response to its announcement of encouraging data from the first MPS IIIB (Sanfilippo syndrome type B) patient treated with gene therapy candidate ABO-101.
    • MPS IIIB (mucopolysaccharidosis type IIIB) is a rare inherited disorder in which the body is unable to break down large sugar molecules. It is characterized by neurocognitive decline, speech and mobility loss and premature death.
    • ABO-101, administered via intravenous injection, was well-tolerated by the patient with no treatment-related adverse events observed through day 30.
    • Early biopotency signals included significant heparan sulfate reductions in cerebral spinal fluid (CSF), urine and plasma. There was also a significant decrease in urinary total glycosaminoglycan (GAG) (class of large sugar molecules that MPS IIIB sufferers cannot break down). Heparan sulfate is the specific GAG that cannot be broken down.
    • The decline (50%) in CSF heparan sulfate supports previous clinical observations that ABO-101 crosses the blood brain barrier.
    • ABO-101 has Rare Pediatric Disease Designation status in the U.S. and Orphan Drug status in the U.S. and Europe for MPS IIIB.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM | 28 Comments
